Eric J. Bowman wrote:
> ...
> But the overriding purpose of PATCH is to save bytes over using PUT. If

It may be the overriding one for you, but that's not necessarily the 
case for everybody.

> we can conceive a way to update XML trees without the PATCH message body
> taking more bytes than using an XPointer query as I've described then
> there is no reason to implement PATCH for XML updates.
> ...

You may want to have a look at XCAP 
(<http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4825>). This has all kinds of issues 
with namespace prefix mapping, scope of ETags, and so on...

Best regards, Julian
